title: Stellated octahedron
summary: The stellated octahedron is the only stellation  of the octahedron. It is also called the stella octangula (Latin for "eight-pointed star"), a name given to it by Johannes Kepler in 1609, though it was known to earlier geometers. It was  depicted in Pacioli's De Divina Proportione, 1509.[2]
